messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
He's breaking into my house!
Listen to me. Who is it?
I don't know who he is!
Okay, and you believe someone's breaking into your house?
Yes! He's breaking in now, hurry!
Okay, can you give me your address?
4980 West 118th Court.
Got it. And you don't know this person?
No, hurry! He's getting in!
Hold on the phone with me, okay?
Hurry, please!
Okay, I'm here with you. I need to get more information. Where are you in the house?
I'm on the second floor.
You're on the second floor, okay. Is this a house?
Yes, hurry, please!
We're dispatching officers right now. Just stay on the phone with me.
Okay, he's in my garage, please, hurry.
Can you lock the door?
Yes, but he's coming through right now. He's coming in!
Hide somewhere and stay very quiet.
He's looking for me. Are they here?
We have officers in the area, they should be there any moment.
He's in the house!
Stay on the phone with me and stay as quiet as possible.
He's coming in!
Does he know you're in there?
I don't think so.
Just stay quiet, the officers are almost there.
What do you want?! I'll give you whatever you want!
Stay calm and quiet, ma'am. Help is almost there.
He's asking for money.
It's okay. Stay quiet. The officers are arriving.
He's in my house. My daughter's outside.
We'll find your daughter. Stay hidden and quiet.
I can't find my daughter. She's only 11.
We'll search for her. The officers are there. Stay on the phone.
He's fighting them!
The officers are trained to handle this. They are taking care of it.
Is he out of my house?
The officers will let you know. You're doing great.
I can't find my daughter.
The officers will help you find her. Stay with me.
Are they talking to you now?
Yes, they're here.
Great. You're safe now. You can hang up the phone.
I need to call my husband.
Go ahead. You're safe now. Goodbye.
